claim: Antiretroviral therapy reduces rates of tuberculosis across a broad range of CD4 strata.

claim: Antiretroviral therapy reduces rates of tuberculosis across a broad range of CD4 strata.
sentence: In 2010, there were an estimated 1.1 million incident cases of tuberculosis among the 34 million people living with HIV worldwide.

claim: Antiretroviral therapy reduces rates of tuberculosis across a broad range of CD4 strata.
sentence: Antiretroviral therapy has substantial potential to prevent HIV-associated tuberculosis.

claim: Antiretroviral therapy reduces rates of tuberculosis across a broad range of CD4 strata.
sentence: We conducted a systematic review of studies that analysed the impact of antiretroviral therapy on the incidence of tuberculosis in adults with HIV infection.

claim: Antiretroviral therapy reduces rates of tuberculosis across a broad range of CD4 strata.
sentence: METHODS AND FINDINGS PubMed, Embase, African Index Medicus, LILACS, and clinical trial registries were systematically searched.

claim: Antiretroviral therapy reduces rates of tuberculosis across a broad range of CD4 strata.
sentence: Randomised controlled trials, prospective cohort studies, and retrospective cohort studies were included if they compared tuberculosis incidence by antiretroviral therapy status in HIV-infected adults for a median of over 6 mo in developing countries.

claim: Antiretroviral therapy reduces rates of tuberculosis across a broad range of CD4 strata.
sentence: For the meta-analyses there were four categories based on CD4 counts at antiretroviral therapy initiation: (1) less than 200 cells/µl, (2) 200 to 350 cells/µl, (3) greater than 350 cells/µl, and (4) any CD4 count.

claim: Antiretroviral therapy reduces rates of tuberculosis across a broad range of CD4 strata.
sentence: Eleven studies met the inclusion criteria.

claim: Antiretroviral therapy reduces rates of tuberculosis across a broad range of CD4 strata.
sentence: Antiretroviral therapy is strongly associated with a reduction in the incidence of tuberculosis in all baseline CD4 count categories: (1) less than 200 cells/µl (hazard ratio [HR] 0.16, 95% confidence interval [CI] 0.07 to 0.36), (2) 200 to 350 cells/µl (HR 0.34, 95% CI 0.19 to 0.60), (3) greater than 350 cells/µl (HR 0.43, 95% CI 0.30 to 0.63), and (4) any CD4 count (HR 0.35, 95% CI 0.28 to 0.44).

claim: Antiretroviral therapy reduces rates of tuberculosis across a broad range of CD4 strata.
sentence: There was no evidence of hazard ratio modification with respect to baseline CD4 count category (p = 0.20).

claim: Antiretroviral therapy reduces rates of tuberculosis across a broad range of CD4 strata.
sentence: CONCLUSIONS Antiretroviral therapy is strongly associated with a reduction in the incidence of tuberculosis across all CD4 count strata.

claim: Antiretroviral therapy reduces rates of tuberculosis across a broad range of CD4 strata.
sentence: Earlier initiation of antiretroviral therapy may be a key component of global and national strategies to control the HIV-associated tuberculosis syndemic.

claim: Antiretroviral therapy reduces rates of tuberculosis across a broad range of CD4 strata.
sentence: REVIEW REGISTRATION International Prospective Register of Systematic Reviews CRD42011001209 Please see later in the article for the Editors' Summary.

claim: Assembly of invadopodia is triggered by focal generation of phosphatidylinositol-3,4-biphosphate and the activation of the nonreceptor tyrosine kinase Src.
sentence: Podosomes (also termed invadopodia in cancer cells) are actin-rich adhesion structures with matrix degradation activity that develop in various cell types.

claim: Assembly of invadopodia is triggered by focal generation of phosphatidylinositol-3,4-biphosphate and the activation of the nonreceptor tyrosine kinase Src.
sentence: Despite their significant physiological importance, the molecular mechanism of podosome formation is largely unknown.

claim: Assembly of invadopodia is triggered by focal generation of phosphatidylinositol-3,4-biphosphate and the activation of the nonreceptor tyrosine kinase Src.
sentence: In this study, we investigated the molecular mechanisms of podosome formation.

claim: Assembly of invadopodia is triggered by focal generation of phosphatidylinositol-3,4-biphosphate and the activation of the nonreceptor tyrosine kinase Src.
sentence: The expression of various phosphoinositide-binding domains revealed that the podosomes in Src-transformed NIH3T3 (NIH-src) cells are enriched with PtdIns(3,4)P2, suggesting an important role of this phosphoinositide in podosome formation.

claim: Assembly of invadopodia is triggered by focal generation of phosphatidylinositol-3,4-biphosphate and the activation of the nonreceptor tyrosine kinase Src.
sentence: Live-cell imaging analysis revealed that Src-expression stimulated podosome formation at focal adhesions of NIH3T3 cells after PtdIns(3,4)P2 accumulation.

claim: Assembly of invadopodia is triggered by focal generation of phosphatidylinositol-3,4-biphosphate and the activation of the nonreceptor tyrosine kinase Src.
sentence: The adaptor protein Tks5/FISH, which is essential for podosome formation, was found to form a complex with Grb2 at adhesion sites in an Src-dependent manner.

claim: Assembly of invadopodia is triggered by focal generation of phosphatidylinositol-3,4-biphosphate and the activation of the nonreceptor tyrosine kinase Src.
sentence: Further, it was found that N-WASP bound all SH3 domains of Tks5/FISH, which facilitated circular podosome formation.

claim: Assembly of invadopodia is triggered by focal generation of phosphatidylinositol-3,4-biphosphate and the activation of the nonreceptor tyrosine kinase Src.
sentence: These results indicate that augmentation of the N-WASP-Arp2/3 signal was accomplished on the platform of Tks5/FISH-Grb2 complex at focal adhesions, which is stabilized by PtdIns(3,4)P2.

claim: Asymptomatic visual impairment screening in elderly populations does not lead to improved vision.
sentence: OBJECTIVE To assess whether population screening for impaired vision among older people in the community leads to improvements in vision.

claim: Asymptomatic visual impairment screening in elderly populations does not lead to improved vision.
sentence: DESIGN Systematic review of randomised controlled trials of population screening in the community that included any assessment of vision or visual function with at least 6 months' follow up.

claim: Asymptomatic visual impairment screening in elderly populations does not lead to improved vision.
sentence: SUBJECTS Adults aged 65 or over.

claim: Asymptomatic visual impairment screening in elderly populations does not lead to improved vision.
sentence: MAIN OUTCOME MEASURE Proportions with visual impairment in intervention and control groups with any method of assessing visual impairment.

claim: Asymptomatic visual impairment screening in elderly populations does not lead to improved vision.
sentence: RESULTS There were no trials that primarily assessed visual screening.

claim: Asymptomatic visual impairment screening in elderly populations does not lead to improved vision.
sentence: Outcome data on vision were available for 3494 people in five trials of multiphasic assessment.

claim: Asymptomatic visual impairment screening in elderly populations does not lead to improved vision.
sentence: All the trials used self reported measures for vision impairment, both as screening tools and as outcome measures.

claim: Asymptomatic visual impairment screening in elderly populations does not lead to improved vision.
sentence: The inclusion of a visual screening component in the assessment did not result in improvements in self reported visual problems (pooled odds ratio 1.04:95% confidence interval 0.89 to 1.22).

claim: Asymptomatic visual impairment screening in elderly populations does not lead to improved vision.
sentence: A small reduction (11%) in the number of older people with self reported visual problems cannot be excluded.

claim: Asymptomatic visual impairment screening in elderly populations does not lead to improved vision.
sentence: CONCLUSIONS Screening of asymptomatic older people in the community is not justified on present evidence.

claim: Asymptomatic visual impairment screening in elderly populations does not lead to improved vision.
sentence: Visual impairment in this age group can usually be reduced with treatment.

claim: Asymptomatic visual impairment screening in elderly populations does not lead to improved vision.
sentence: It is unclear why no benefit was seen.

claim: Asymptomatic visual impairment screening in elderly populations does not lead to improved vision.
sentence: Further work is needed to clarify what interventions are appropriate for older people with unreported impairment of vision.

claim: Auditory entrainment is strengthened when people see congruent visual and auditory information.
sentence: UNLABELLED Congruent audiovisual speech enhances our ability to comprehend a speaker, even in noise-free conditions.

claim: Auditory entrainment is strengthened when people see congruent visual and auditory information.
sentence: When incongruent auditory and visual information is presented concurrently, it can hinder a listener's perception and even cause him or her to perceive information that was not presented in either modality.

claim: Auditory entrainment is strengthened when people see congruent visual and auditory information.
sentence: Efforts to investigate the neural basis of these effects have often focused on the special case of discrete audiovisual syllables that are spatially and temporally congruent, with less work done on the case of natural, continuous speech.

claim: Auditory entrainment is strengthened when people see congruent visual and auditory information.
sentence: Recent electrophysiological studies have demonstrated that cortical response measures to continuous auditory speech can be easily obtained using multivariate analysis methods.

claim: Auditory entrainment is strengthened when people see congruent visual and auditory information.
sentence: Here, we apply such methods to the case of audiovisual speech and, importantly, present a novel framework for indexing multisensory integration in the context of continuous speech.

claim: Auditory entrainment is strengthened when people see congruent visual and auditory information.
sentence: Specifically, we examine how the temporal and contextual congruency of ongoing audiovisual speech affects the cortical encoding of the speech envelope in humans using electroencephalography.

claim: Auditory entrainment is strengthened when people see congruent visual and auditory information.
sentence: We demonstrate that the cortical representation of the speech envelope is enhanced by the presentation of congruent audiovisual speech in noise-free conditions.

claim: Auditory entrainment is strengthened when people see congruent visual and auditory information.
sentence: Furthermore, we show that this is likely attributable to the contribution of neural generators that are not particularly active during unimodal stimulation and that it is most prominent at the temporal scale corresponding to syllabic rate (2-6 Hz).

claim: Auditory entrainment is strengthened when people see congruent visual and auditory information.
sentence: Finally, our data suggest that neural entrainment to the speech envelope is inhibited when the auditory and visual streams are incongruent both temporally and contextually.

claim: Auditory entrainment is strengthened when people see congruent visual and auditory information.
sentence: SIGNIFICANCE STATEMENT Seeing a speaker's face as he or she talks can greatly help in understanding what the speaker is saying.

claim: Auditory entrainment is strengthened when people see congruent visual and auditory information.
sentence: This is because the speaker's facial movements relay information about what the speaker is saying, but also, importantly, when the speaker is saying it.

claim: Auditory entrainment is strengthened when people see congruent visual and auditory information.
sentence: Studying how the brain uses this timing relationship to combine information from continuous auditory and visual speech has traditionally been methodologically difficult.

claim: Auditory entrainment is strengthened when people see congruent visual and auditory information.
sentence: Here we introduce a new approach for doing this using relatively inexpensive and noninvasive scalp recordings.

claim: Auditory entrainment is strengthened when people see congruent visual and auditory information.
sentence: Specifically, we show that the brain's representation of auditory speech is enhanced when the accompanying visual speech signal shares the same timing.

claim: Auditory entrainment is strengthened when people see congruent visual and auditory information.
sentence: Furthermore, we show that this enhancement is most pronounced at a time scale that corresponds to mean syllable length.

claim: Autologous transplantation of mesenchymal stem cells causes a higher rate of opportunistic infections than induction therapy with anti-interleukin-2 receptor antibodies.
sentence: CONTEXT Antibody-based induction therapy plus calcineurin inhibitors (CNIs) reduce acute rejection rates in kidney recipients; however, opportunistic infections and toxic CNI effects remain challenging.

claim: Autologous transplantation of mesenchymal stem cells causes a higher rate of opportunistic infections than induction therapy with anti-interleukin-2 receptor antibodies.
sentence: Reportedly, mesenchymal stem cells (MSCs) have successfully treated graft-vs-host disease.

claim: Autologous transplantation of mesenchymal stem cells causes a higher rate of opportunistic infections than induction therapy with anti-interleukin-2 receptor antibodies.
sentence: OBJECTIVE To assess autologous MSCs as replacement of antibody induction for patients with end-stage renal disease who undergo ABO-compatible, cross-match-negative kidney transplants from a living-related donor.

claim: Autologous transplantation of mesenchymal stem cells causes a higher rate of opportunistic infections than induction therapy with anti-interleukin-2 receptor antibodies.
sentence: DESIGN, SETTING, AND PATIENTS One hundred fifty-nine patients were enrolled in this single-site, prospective, open-label, randomized study from February 2008-May 2009, when recruitment was completed.

claim: Autologous transplantation of mesenchymal stem cells causes a higher rate of opportunistic infections than induction therapy with anti-interleukin-2 receptor antibodies.
sentence: INTERVENTION Patients were inoculated with marrow-derived autologous MSC (1-2 x 10(6)/kg) at kidney reperfusion and two weeks later.

claim: Autologous transplantation of mesenchymal stem cells causes a higher rate of opportunistic infections than induction therapy with anti-interleukin-2 receptor antibodies.
sentence: Fifty-three patients received standard-dose and 52 patients received low-dose CNIs (80% of standard); 51 patients in the control group received anti-IL-2 receptor antibody plus standard-dose CNIs.

claim: Autologous transplantation of mesenchymal stem cells causes a higher rate of opportunistic infections than induction therapy with anti-interleukin-2 receptor antibodies.
sentence: MAIN OUTCOME MEASURES The primary measure was 1-year incidence of acute rejection and renal function (estimated glomerular filtration rate [eGFR]); the secondary measure was patient and graft survival and incidence of adverse events.

claim: Autologous transplantation of mesenchymal stem cells causes a higher rate of opportunistic infections than induction therapy with anti-interleukin-2 receptor antibodies.

claim: Autophagy declines in aged organisms.
sentence: Chaperone-mediated autophagy (CMA), a selective mechanism for degradation of cytosolic proteins in lysosomes, contributes to the removal of altered proteins as part of the cellular quality-control systems.

claim: Autophagy declines in aged organisms.
sentence: We have previously found that CMA activity declines in aged organisms and have proposed that this failure in cellular clearance could contribute to the accumulation of altered proteins, the abnormal cellular homeostasis and, eventually, the functional loss characteristic of aged organisms.

claim: Autophagy declines in aged organisms.
sentence: To determine whether these negative features of aging can be prevented by maintaining efficient autophagic activity until late in life, in this work we have corrected the CMA defect in aged rodents.

claim: Autophagy declines in aged organisms.
sentence: We have generated a double transgenic mouse model in which the amount of the lysosomal receptor for CMA, previously shown to decrease in abundance with age, can be modulated.

claim: Autophagy declines in aged organisms.
sentence: We have analyzed in this model the consequences of preventing the age-dependent decrease in receptor abundance in aged rodents at the cellular and organ levels.

claim: Autophagy declines in aged organisms.
sentence: We show here that CMA activity is maintained until advanced ages if the decrease in the receptor abundance is prevented and that preservation of autophagic activity is associated with lower intracellular accumulation of damaged proteins, better ability to handle protein damage and improved organ function.

claim: Bariatric surgery has a positive impact on mental health.
sentence: IMPORTANCE Bariatric surgery is associated with sustained weight loss and improved physical health status for severely obese individuals.

claim: Bariatric surgery has a positive impact on mental health.
sentence: Mental health conditions may be common among patients seeking bariatric surgery; however, the prevalence of these conditions and whether they are associated with postoperative outcomes remains unknown.

claim: Bariatric surgery has a positive impact on mental health.
sentence: OBJECTIVE To determine the prevalence of mental health conditions among bariatric surgery candidates and recipients, to evaluate the association between preoperative mental health conditions and health outcomes following bariatric surgery, and to evaluate the association between surgery and the clinical course of mental health conditions.

claim: Bariatric surgery has a positive impact on mental health.
sentence: DATA SOURCES We searched PubMed, MEDLINE on OVID, and PsycINFO for studies published between January 1988 and November 2015.

claim: Bariatric surgery has a positive impact on mental health.
sentence: Study quality was assessed using an adapted tool for risk of bias; quality of evidence was rated based on GRADE (Grading of Recommendations Assessment, Development and Evaluation) criteria.

claim: Bariatric surgery has a positive impact on mental health.
sentence: FINDINGS We identified 68 publications meeting inclusion criteria: 59 reporting the prevalence of preoperative mental health conditions (65,363 patients) and 27 reporting associations between preoperative mental health conditions and postoperative outcomes (50,182 patients).

claim: Bariatric surgery has a positive impact on mental health.
sentence: Among patients seeking and undergoing bariatric surgery, the most common mental health conditions, based on random-effects estimates of prevalence, were depression (19% [95% CI, 14%-25%]) and binge eating disorder (17% [95% CI, 13%-21%]).

claim: Bariatric surgery has a positive impact on mental health.
sentence: There was conflicting evidence regarding the association between preoperative mental health conditions and postoperative weight loss.

claim: Bariatric surgery has a positive impact on mental health.
sentence: Neither depression nor binge eating disorder was consistently associated with differences in weight outcomes.

claim: Bariatric surgery has a positive impact on mental health.
sentence: Bariatric surgery was, however, consistently associated with postoperative decreases in the prevalence of depression (7 studies; 8%-74% decrease) and the severity of depressive symptoms (6 studies; 40%-70% decrease).

claim: Bariatric surgery has a positive impact on mental health.
sentence: CONCLUSIONS AND RELEVANCE Mental health conditions are common among bariatric surgery patients-in particular, depression and binge eating disorder.

claim: Bariatric surgery has a positive impact on mental health.
sentence: There is inconsistent evidence regarding the association between preoperative mental health conditions and postoperative weight loss.

claim: Bariatric surgery has a positive impact on mental health.
sentence: Moderate-quality evidence supports an association between bariatric surgery and lower rates of depression postoperatively.

sentence: We report that activation of basophils by autoreactive IgE causes their homing to lymph nodes, promoting T helper type 2 (T(H)2) cell differentiation and enhancing the production of self-reactive antibodies that cause lupus-like nephritis in mice lacking the Src family protein tyrosine kinase Lyn (Lyn(-/-) mice).

claim: Basophils counteract disease development in patients with systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE).
sentence: Individuals with SLE also have elevated serum IgE, self-reactive IgEs and activated basophils that express CD62 ligand (CD62L) and the major histocompatibility complex (MHC) class II molecule human leukocyte antigen-DR (HLA-DR), parameters that are associated with increased disease activity and active lupus nephritis.

claim: Basophils counteract disease development in patients with systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE).
sentence: Basophils were also present in the lymph nodes and spleen of subjects with SLE.

claim: Basophils counteract disease development in patients with systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE).
sentence: Thus, in Lyn(-/-) mice, basophils and IgE autoantibodies amplify autoantibody production that leads to lupus nephritis, and in individuals with SLE IgE autoantibodies and activated basophils are factors associated with disease activity and nephritis.

claim: Birth-weight is positively associated with breast cancer.

claim: Birth-weight is positively associated with breast cancer.

claim: Birth-weight is positively associated with breast cancer.

claim: Birth-weight is positively associated with breast cancer.
sentence: Birth length and head circumference from birth records were also positively associated with breast cancer risk (pooled RR per one SD increment: 1.06 [95% CI 1.03-1.10] and 1.09 [95% CI 1.03-1.15], respectively).

claim: Birth-weight is positively associated with breast cancer.
sentence: Simultaneous adjustment for these three birth size variables showed that length was the strongest independent predictor of risk.

claim: Birth-weight is positively associated with breast cancer.

claim: Birth-weight is positively associated with breast cancer.

claim: Birth-weight is positively associated with breast cancer.
sentence: CONCLUSIONS This pooled analysis of individual participant data is consistent with birth size, and in particular birth length, being an independent correlate of breast cancer risk in adulthood.

claim: Birth-weight is positively associated with breast cancer.

claim: Birth-weight is positively associated with breast cancer.

claim: Birth-weight is positively associated with breast cancer.
sentence: METHODS We reviewed breast cancer studies published from January 1966 to February 2007 that included data on birth weight, birth order, maternal age, gestational age, twin status, and maternal or paternal smoking.

claim: Birth-weight is positively associated with breast cancer.

claim: Birth-weight is positively associated with breast cancer.
sentence: RESULTS We found that heavier birth weights were associated with increased breast cancer risk, with studies involving five categories of birth weight identifying odds ratios (ORs) of 1.24 (95% confidence interval [CI] 1.04 to 1.48) for 4,000 g or more and 1.15 (95% CI 1.04 to 1.26) for 3,500 g to 3,999 g, relative to a birth weight of 2,500 to 2,599 g. These studies provided no support for a J-shaped relationship of birthweight to risk.

claim: Birth-weight is positively associated with breast cancer.

claim: Birth-weight is positively associated with breast cancer.

claim: Blocking the interaction between TDP-43 and respiratory complex I proteins ND3 and ND6 leads to increased TDP-43-induced neuronal loss.

claim: Blocking the interaction between TDP-43 and respiratory complex I proteins ND3 and ND6 leads to increased TDP-43-induced neuronal loss.

claim: Blocking the interaction between TDP-43 and respiratory complex I proteins ND3 and ND6 leads to increased TDP-43-induced neuronal loss.

claim: Blocking the interaction between TDP-43 and respiratory complex I proteins ND3 and ND6 leads to increased TDP-43-induced neuronal loss.

claim: Bone marrow cells contribute to adult macrophage compartments.

claim: Breast cancer development is determined exclusively by genetic factors.

claim: Breast cancer development is determined exclusively by genetic factors.

claim: Breast cancer development is determined exclusively by genetic factors.

claim: CR is associated with higher methylation age.

claim: CR is associated with higher methylation age.

claim: CR is associated with higher methylation age.

claim: CR is associated with higher methylation age.

claim: CR is associated with higher methylation age.

claim: Carriers of the alcohol aldehyde dehydrogenase deficiency mutation drink less that non-carries.

claim: Carriers of the alcohol aldehyde dehydrogenase deficiency mutation drink less that non-carries.

claim: Carriers of the alcohol aldehyde dehydrogenase deficiency mutation drink less that non-carries.

claim: Cellular aging closely links to an older appearance.
sentence: OBJECTIVE To determine whether perceived age correlates with survival and important age related phenotypes.

claim: Cellular aging closely links to an older appearance.
sentence: DESIGN Follow-up study, with survival of twins determined up to January 2008, by which time 675 (37%) had died.

claim: Cellular aging closely links to an older appearance.
sentence: SETTING Population based twin cohort in Denmark.

sentence: PARTICIPANTS 20 nurses, 10 young men, and 11 older women (assessors); 1826 twins aged >or=70.

claim: Cellular aging closely links to an older appearance.

claim: Cellular aging closely links to an older appearance.
sentence: Twins: physical and cognitive tests and molecular biomarker of ageing (leucocyte telomere length).

claim: Cellular aging closely links to an older appearance.
sentence: RESULTS For all three groups of assessors, perceived age was significantly associated with survival, even after adjustment for chronological age, sex, and rearing environment.

claim: Cellular aging closely links to an older appearance.
sentence: Perceived age was still significantly associated with survival after further adjustment for physical and cognitive functioning.

claim: Cellular aging closely links to an older appearance.
sentence: The likelihood that the older looking twin of the pair died first increased with increasing discordance in perceived age within the twin pair-that is, the bigger the difference in perceived age within the pair, the more likely that the older looking twin died first.

claim: Cellular aging closely links to an older appearance.
sentence: Twin analyses suggested that common genetic factors influence both perceived age and survival.

claim: Cellular aging closely links to an older appearance.
sentence: Perceived age, controlled for chronological age and sex, also correlated significantly with physical and cognitive functioning as well as with leucocyte telomere length.

claim: Cellular aging closely links to an older appearance.
sentence: CONCLUSION Perceived age-which is widely used by clinicians as a general indication of a patient's health-is a robust biomarker of ageing that predicts survival among those aged >or=70 and correlates with important functional and molecular ageing phenotypes.

claim: Hypoglycemia increases the risk of dementia.

claim: Hypoglycemia increases the risk of dementia.

claim: Hypoglycemia increases the risk of dementia.

claim: Hypoglycemia increases the risk of dementia.

claim: Leuko-increased blood increases infectious complications in red blood cell transfusion.

claim: Leuko-increased blood increases infectious complications in red blood cell transfusion.

claim: Leuko-increased blood increases infectious complications in red blood cell transfusion.

claim: Leuko-increased blood increases infectious complications in red blood cell transfusion.

claim: Leuko-increased blood increases infectious complications in red blood cell transfusion.

claim: Leuko-increased blood increases infectious complications in red blood cell transfusion.

claim: Participating in six months of physical activity improves cognitive functioning.

claim: Participating in six months of physical activity improves cognitive functioning.

claim: Participating in six months of physical activity improves cognitive functioning.

claim: Participating in six months of physical activity improves cognitive functioning.
sentence: At 18 months, participants in the intervention group improved 0.73 points (95% confidence interval, -1.27 to 0.03) on the ADAS-Cog, and those in the usual care group improved 0.04 points (95% confidence interval, -0.46 to 0.88).

claim: Participating in six months of physical activity improves cognitive functioning.
sentence: Word list delayed recall and Clinical Dementia Rating sum of boxes improved modestly as well, whereas word list total immediate recall, digit symbol coding, verbal fluency, Beck depression score, and Medical Outcomes 36-Item Short-Form physical and mental component summaries did not change significantly.

claim: Participating in six months of physical activity improves cognitive functioning.

sentence: RESULTS During follow up 2985 (80%) participants reported a stable partnership on at least one occasion.

claim: Patients in stable partnerships have a faster progression from HIV to AIDS.
sentence: In an analysis stratified by previous antiretroviral therapy and clinical stage when starting HAART (US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention group A, B, or C), the adjusted hazard ratio for progression to AIDS or death was 0.79 (95% confidence interval 0.63 to 0.98) for participants with a stable partnership compared with those without.

claim: Patients in stable partnerships have a faster progression from HIV to AIDS.

claim: Patients in stable partnerships have a faster progression from HIV to AIDS.
sentence: CONCLUSIONS A stable partnership is associated with a slower rate of progression to AIDS or death in HIV infected patients receiving HAART.
